reviewText: Extremely disappointed with this edition. We bought this one specifically because it was the blue-ray digital combined edition. Despite the packaging indicating that the digital edition is for the US and Canada, the digital code is not redeemable in the US.
Quality was Great. Our family REALLY enjoyed this movie!!

There is a big difference between the Blu-ray version and the DVD. On my 48" Samsung HD television screen, I am able to see details that are obvious:
.
1. Looking at the facial closeups, especially the old nuns, the observer is able to view individual hair strands with their different shades and colors. Some are mis-combed. Cosmetics also fail to hide pimples, wrinkles, blemishes, brown spots, and pores.
.
2. Individual stitches on Maria's hat are observable. Likewise, her nun's jacket exhibits various folds and creases, stitchings, and worn ends.
.
I am not able to see the above on the DVD version.
